comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: One of a sequence of at least 11 Bain photos, probably circulated around the time of Booker T. Washington's death in November, 1915, depicting people and activities connected with the institution he founded in Tuskegee, Alabama in 1881, and to which he devoted his life. An African-American educator, Washington created the Tuskegee Normal School for Colored Teachers, later known as the Tuskegee Institute and now as Tuskegee University, Tuskegee is a private, historically Black university. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuskegee_University en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Booker_T._Washington

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks, ArtoIog, for explaining the timing of the pictures and connecting the sequence. You've got me wondering if the photos might be by Frances Benjamin Johnston. She worked for Bain early in her career, and took more than 500 photos of Tuskegee in 1902-1906, www.loc.gov/pictures/collection/coll/item/86706935/ I'll try to check on Monday, Helena (LOC)

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: They don't seem to be any of the Johnston photos of Tuskegee that LOC has online.
